#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Act at a Formal Dinner or Fancy Restaurant
#Text=Are you trying to keep from reliving another embarrassing moment in a social setting or simply trying to prevent one from ever happening ?
#Text=Regardless , you 're in the right place .
#Text=This simple guide covers everything from simple ways to look elegant and formal to how to act from your steps to the way you sit and eat at the table .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Look the part .
#Text=If you have long hair consider having your hair up , a less popular , but practical and sleeker option .
#Text=Although down-dos are more common , up-dos are simple , neat , and stylish .
#Text=Up-dos will not only make your hair stand out amid combed out hairdos , but keep it clear of your face as you eat .
#Text=Your nails should be manicured : clean , cut and if painted , coloured to match your outfit .
#Text=If you put makeup on , highlight either your eyes or your lips , or go for a more natural look .
#Text=Less is more .
#Text=Choose a suitable outfit .
#Text=Dress codes can be difficult to navigate , so be sure you know what it is .
#Text=For a restaurant , check their website .
#Text=For a dinner party , look at the invitation .
#Text=If you are still in the dark , ask your host or a friend who you know is going .
#Text=The best bet if you are unsure is a jacket and tie or a chiffon dress to the knee .
#Text=If you are carrying a handbag match your bag with your shoes .
#Text=Sit properly .
#Text=Cross your legs at the heels with your knees together and ankles tucked back , this is especially important when wearing skirts and dresses .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you have been invited to a restaurant by someone else , do not complain about the food or the service .
#Text=Anything that is in your hands when you sit at the table , such as your gloves or little bag , should be put in your lap .

#Text=To avoid the things in your lap from slipping off , put the napkin across your knees , folded diagonally from corner to corner , and tuck the two side corners under , pinning your things into place .

#Text=When a dinner has been prepared by a chef who prides himself on being a decorative artist , you may have quite a problem to know which part of an intricate structure is to be eaten and which part is scenic effect .
#Text=The main portion is generally clear enough .
#Text=If there are six or more , the chances are that they are edible and that one or two of a kind are embellishments only .
#Text=Rings around food are nearly always to be eaten , whereas platforms under food seldom are .
#Text=Anything that looks like pastry is meant to be eaten .
#Text=Again , take direction from the host .
#Text=Manners are key !
#Text=Keep the conversation flowing , but never interrupt anyone .
#Text=It is impolite for more than one person to leave the table at a time , regardless of the number of people at the table .
#Text=If at a fancy or formal restaurant , some will expect the inviter to pay the bill , not the invitee .
#Text=However , in this day and age , it 's not uncommon to split a bill .
#Text=Always keep the napkin or cloth on your lap when eating .
#Text=When leaving , kindly excuse yourself from the table and place your napkin on the table .
#Text=Do not use your cell phone at the table while you 're eating .
#Text=Turn your cell phone onto silent mode during the meal .
#Text=If you must leave it on , excuse yourself if it rings to go outside or to a private area .
#Text=Follow the direction of the host/hostess .
#Text=Be courteous .
#Text=Say " please " and " thank you " .
#Text=You may call elders or people with whom you are unfamiliar " sir " or " ma'am " , although it is an uncommon courtesy that is definitely unnecessary when speaking to friends or peers .
#Text=It is better to keep your legs closed rather than crossing them in public , especially when sitting at the table .
#Text=This can cause discomfort especially if the table is not high enough .
#Text=Never apply makeup at the table .
#Text=Once again , excuse yourself to the powder room .
#Text=When walking in high heels the heel should hit the ground first , then the toe .
#Text=It has been proven not to be necessary to pace yourself in formal footwear , but walking turtle slow will make you appear as if you 're trying too hard to be impressive .
#Text=Always show up on time .
#Text=For meals , there is no such thing as fashionably late .
#Text=If you are n't there by five minutes past the time on the invitation , the food will begin to get cold and fellow guests hungry .
#Text=In Europe
#Text=you are given exactly 15 minutes leeway , known as the ' academic quarter ' .
#Text=Remember your table manners , do n't talk when you still have food in your mouth .
#Text=Never start eating until the hosts are seated and they begin to eat .
#Text=Do n't talk over somebody else ; it is rude .
#Text=If you must , push your chair back slightly and speak behind them .
#Text=Be gracious and congenial - after all , your hosts have gone to great lengths for you .

#Text=Do n't sit silently at the table , try participate in conversation even if you are nervous , some remembered lines can be helpful , for example ' have you come far ? ' might get a conversation going , without being as prying as the question ' where do you live ' .
#Text=When getting out of a vehicle try your best to exit without showing your undergarments .
#Text=If there is a someone opening the door for you , remember to thank them .
#Text=It is impolite to refuse dishes .
#Text=Take at least a little on your plate and make a pretense of eating some of it , unless you are allergic to it or reasonably cannot .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Though your friends are your friends and you should always be yourself , treat everyone with the same respect and get out of those slang using habits .
#Text=People will also lose respect for you if you use gross humor in any setting .
